Method Detail

getSuperclassChain

public static <S> List<Class<? extends S>> getSuperclassChain(Class<? extends S> clazz,
                                                              Class<S> superclass)
Returns one of the possible chains of superclasses and/or interfaces joining the specified class to the given superclass, as returned by getSuperclassChains(Class, Class). Which of the possible chains will be returned is not defined.

If superclass is not a superclass or -interface of class, the method returns null. This may happen (in spite of the signature) if the method is called with non-generic arguments.

Type Parameters:
S - the type of the superclass at the "end" of the chain
Parameters:
clazz - the class at the "start" of the superclass chain
superclass - the class at the "end" of the superclass chain
Returns:
one superclass chain linking class to superclass, where successive elements of the list are immediate superclasses or -interfaces. If class is not a subclass of superclass, returns null.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if either argument is null
See Also:
getSuperclassChains(Class, Class)

getSuperclassChains

public static <S> Set<List<Class<? extends S>>> getSuperclassChains(Class<? extends S> clazz,
                                                                    Class<S> superclass)
Returns the chain of superclass and/or interfaces from the specified class to the given superclass. Either parameter may be an interface.

Each list in the resulting set contains immediate superclass elements in order, i.e. for classes 

 class Foo {}
 class Bar extends Foo {}
 class Baz extends Bar {}
getSuperclassChains(Baz.class, Foo.class) will return one list, [Baz.class, Bar.class, Foo.class].

If both parameters are classes, there can only be one possible chain. However, if the superclass is an interface, there may be multiple possible inheritance chains. For instance, for 

 interface Foo {}
 interface Bar1 extends Foo {}
 interface Bar2 extends Foo {}
 interface Baz extends Bar1, Bar2 {}
both [Baz.class, Bar1.class, Foo.class] and [Baz.class, Bar2.class, Foo.class] are valid inheritance chains, and the method returns both.

If superclass is not a superclass or -interface of class, the method returns an empty set. This may happen (in spite of the signature) if the method is called with non-generic arguments.

Type Parameters:
S - the type of the superclass at the "end" of the chain
Parameters:
clazz - the class at the "start" of the superclass chain
superclass - the class at the "end" of the superclass chain
Returns:
all possible superclass chains linking class to superclass, where successive elements of the list are immediate superclasses or -interfaces. If class is not a subclass of superclass, returns an empty set.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if either argument is null
See Also:
getSuperclassChain(Class, Class)

isAnyAssignableFrom

public static boolean isAnyAssignableFrom(Collection<Class<?>> superclasses,
                                          Class<?> clazz)
Determines if any of the given superclasses is a superclass or -interface of the specified class. See Class.isAssignableFrom(Class).

Parameters:
superclasses - the superclasses and -interfaces to be tested against
clazz - the class to be to be checked
Returns:
true iff any of the given classes is a superclass or -interface of the specified class
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if either of the arguments is null

                                 Object instance)

Parameters:

instance - the object to be to be checked
Returns:
true iff the object is an instance of any of the given classes interfaces
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if either of the arguments is null

getAllDeclaredFields

public static List<Field> getAllDeclaredFields(Class<?> clazz)
Collects all fields declared in the given class and inherited from parents.

Parameters:
clazz - the class to parse
Returns:
a list of all fields declared in the class or its parents, in the order determined by successive Class.getDeclaredFields() calls
See Also:
getAllDeclaredFields(Class, Class)

getAllDeclaredFields

public static <T> List<Field> getAllDeclaredFields(Class<T> clazz,
                                                   Class<? super T> superclass)
Collects all fields declared in the given class and inherited from parents up to and including the given parent class.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the class to parse
Parameters:
clazz - the class to parse
superclass - the superclass of the class to parse at which traversal should be stopped
Returns:
a list of all fields declared in the class or its parents up to and including the given parent class, in the order determined by successive Class.getDeclaredFields() calls
See Also:

getAllAnnotatedDeclaredFields

public static List<Field> getAllAnnotatedDeclaredFields(Class<?> clazz,
                                                        Class<? extends Annotation> annotationType)
Collects all fields declared in the given class and inherited from parents that are annotated with an annotation of the given type.

Parameters:
clazz - the class to parse
annotationType - the non-null type (class) of the annotation required
Returns:
a list of all fields declared in the class or its parents, in the order determined by successive Class.getDeclaredFields() calls
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if clazz or annotationType is null

getAnnotatedMethods

public static Set<Method> getAnnotatedMethods(Class<?> clazz,
                                              Class<? extends Annotation> annotationType)
Collects all methods of the given class (as returned by Class.getMethods() that are annotated with the given annotation.

Parameters:
clazz - the class whose methods should be returned
annotationType - the annotation that the returned methods should be annotated with
Returns:
the methods of the given class annotated with the given annotation
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if clazz is null

getActualTypeArguments

public static <S> List<Class<?>> getActualTypeArguments(Class<? extends S> typedClass,
                                                        Class<S> typedSuperclass)
Retrieves the type arguments of a class when regarded as an subclass of the given typed superclass or interface. The order of the runtime type classes matches the order of the type variables in the declaration of the typed superclass or interface.

For example, for the classes 

 class Foo<U, V> {}
 class Bar<W> extends Foo<String, W> {}
 class Baz extends Bar<Long>
and a typedClass argument of Baz.class, the method should return

  • [String, Long] for a typedSuperclass argument of Foo.class, and
  • [Long] if typedSuperclass is Bar.class.
For type parameters that cannot be determined, null is returned.

Note: It is not possible to retrieve type information that is not available in the (super)class hierarchy at compile-time. Calling getActualTypeArguments(new ArrayList<String>().getClass(), List.class) will, for instance, return [null] because the specification of the actual type (String, in this example) did not take place either in the superclass AbstractList or the interface List.

If superclass is not a superclass or -interface of class, the method returns null. This may happen (in spite of the signature) if the method is called with non-generic arguments.

Type Parameters:
S - the type of the object
Parameters:
typedClass - the class for which type information is required
typedSuperclass - the typed class or interface of which the object is to be regarded a subclass
Returns:
the type arguments for the given class when regarded as a subclass of the given typed superclass, in the order defined in the superclass. If class is not a subclass of superclass, returns null.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if typedSuperclass or typedClass is null
